title: Paul Pogba no closer to justifying his world record transfer fee than the day he signed for Manchester United
text:
Sport Opinion Paul Pogba no closer to justifying his world record transfer fee than the day he signed for Manchester United This is a debut season going from bad to worse for the world's most expensive star, writes Steve Bates Share Paul Pogba is not justifying his world record fee yet at Man United (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Sooner or later they reckon, Paul Pogba will come good. 
Don't hold your breath though because Donald Trump might win the Nobel Peace Prize first. 
For this is a debut season going from bad to worse for the world's most expensive star who suffered a fresh blow as he limped off against FC Rostov on Thursday night after pulling up sharply just after half time. 
You know you're in trouble when your manager risks ridicule defending you to the football world. 
Mourinho claimed before Thursday night's Europa League clash that envy was driving the backlash against the £89 million star. 
But after an embarrassingly bad opening 45 minutes against the Russian side maybe even Mourinho was left wondering whether his robust public display of support for Pogba was a wise move. Paul Pogba hobbled off injured in the Europa League win over FC Rostov (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) It hasn't been a season to remember for £89m Paul Pogba yet (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
After being outshone by Chelsea road-runner N'Golo Cante in the FA Cup here was the chance for Pogba to bite back at the critics who claim his fellow Frenchman is twice the player at way less than half the cost. 
The game, though, didn't start well for Pogba. With less than 20 seconds on the clock the Frenchman tried one of his infuriating flicks, lost the ball and end up conceding a foul. 
And it didn't get any better. 
Some might say his shocker was par for the course for the hapless midfielder on recent evidence. But what followed was poor even by his falling standards. 
Mis-placed passes and shots wildly off target suggest a player short on confidence, strange given his social media persona , changing hair-cuts and new dances. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
